result.execSummary:
The defendant Kentrell Deshawn Hughlett was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possess w/Intent-Heroin(>10-50g), a class D felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1m)(d)3.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Pay mandatory costs, assessments and surcharges by the end of the sentence or a civil judgment is to be entered against the defendant and subject to other collection.  
Pay any monetary amounts ordered but not paid while in the institution. DOC to collect monetary sums/amounts at the rate of 25% of prison funds.

superMiscConds.notes: No violations of criminal law rising to the level of probable cause. No illegally controlled substances.
AODA, programs or treatment as recommended. Random screening.
COURT ADVISES the defendant he cannot possess firearms, he must provide a DNA sample, and cannot vote until his civil rights are restored.

supervisions.notes: Provide a DNA sample; pay surcharge. Pay all applicable mandatory costs and surcharges from prison funds, including wages and all other monies,in an amount or percentage the Dept. of Corrections (DOC) determines to be reasonable and as a condition of Extended Supervision. Any remaining balance to convert to a civil judgment. Previously paid from CASH BAIL ON DEPOSIT.

**01-11-2017/Judge David Swanson**
COURT ORDERED PREVIOUS SENTENCE VACATED
Consecutive to: 15CF844 AND any other sentence with credit for 753 days time served.
Conditions of ES to be determined at the discretion of the DOC's

COURT ADVISES the defendant that he is REQUIRED to provide a DNA sample; pay surcharge, however if this conviction is reversed, set aside or vacated he may qualify to have the DNA sample data expunged if he meets conditions under the statute, and that he cannot vote until his civil rights are restored. Defendant advised that he may not possess a firearm and if the defendant possesses a firearm within 5 years of the completion of this sentence, he will be subject to a 3 year mandatory initial confinement.

Attorney Frederick F Klimetz in court, defendant Kentrell Deshawn Hughlett not in court, in custody.  
Jessica Bellows appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Deputy Court Clerk: DDS.

CASE RECALLED.  Appearance of defendant waived by defense.  Defense requests to have this matter recalled to make correction as to number of credit days served.  

The court GRANTS 753 DAYS OF CREDIT.

The court further orders conditions of extended supervision to be determined/at the discretion of the Department of Corrections.  Filed, Pretrial Incarceration Credit form.

Defendant Kentrell Deshawn Hughlett in court with attorney Frederick F Klimetz.  Defendant Kentrell Deshawn Hughlett in custody.  
Jessica Bellows appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: DDS.

***Matter before the Court for RESENTENCING HEARING***

Sentencing proceeds. Statements made by counsel and defendant.  Additional statement made by Jamette S.

COURT ADVISES the defendant that he is REQUIRED to provide a DNA sample and pay surcharge, however if this conviction is reversed, set aside or vacated he may qualify to have the DNA sample data expunged if he meets conditions under the statute, and that he cannot vote until his civil rights are restored. Defendant advised that if he is not a US citizen deportation is possible.  Defendant advised that he may not possess a firearm and if the defendant possesses a firearm within 5 years of the completion of this sentence, he will be subject to a 3 year mandatory initial confinement.

COUNT 1:  The Court sentenced the defendant to a MAXIMUM TERM OF IMPRISONMENT of 12 YEARS, CONSECUTIVE to 15CF000844 AND any other sentence with credit for 479 days. 
The INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT in the Wisconsin State Prison System is 7 YEARS.  The MAXIMUM TERM OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION IS 5 YEARS.

The defendant IS eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program and the Substance Abuse Program.  
  
The defendant shall pay all applicable mandatory costs and surcharges from prison funds, including wages and all other monies, in an amount or percentage the Department (DOC) determines to be reasonable and as a condition of extended supervision.  Any remaining balance to convert to civil judgment.

Defendant advised of his right to seek postconviction relief.
  
Filed:
-Pretrial Incarceration Credit 
-Written Explanation of Determinate Sentence- copy to defendant.

Matter before the Court for Status conference.  Defendant not produced from New Lisbon.

Received and Filed, Proposed Orders with cover letter.

Case recalled after break for decision. Appearance remain the same. Court places findings on the record. For reasons stated on the record, Court denies defendant's motion to vacate plea. Court grants defendant's motion to vacate sentencing and schedules re-sentencing in Branch 11. Attorney Holzman to notify public defender's office for appointment of counsel for re-sentencing. Case adjourned in Branch 11.

Defendant Kentrell Deshawn Hughlett in court with attorney Douglas Michael Bihler.  Defendant Kentrell Deshawn Hughlett in custody.  Marissa Luz Santiago appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Clerk;ds

Sentencing proceeds.  Corrections made to the presentence investigation report.  Statements by counsel and defendant. COURT ADVISES the defendant he cannot possess firearms, he must provide a DNA sample, and cannot vote until his civil rights are restored.  

COURT ORDERS defendant to serve a term in the Wisconsin State Prison system - TOTAL LENGTH OF SENTENCE - 15 years with 3 days credit -  INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT - 10 years  -  EXTENDED SUPERVISION - 5 years; pay mandatory costs, assessments and surcharges by the end of the sentence or a civil judgment is to be entered against the defendant and subject to other collection.  

CONDITIONS OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION:  1) no violations of criminal law rising to the level of probable cause; 2) pay any monetary amounts ordered but not paid while in the institution; 3) AODA, programs or treatment as recommended; 4) no illegally controlled substances; 5) random screening.

Court finds defendant is not eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program or the Substance Abuse Program.

COURT ORDERS:
-  defendant to provide a biological specimen for DNA analysis;
-  DOC to collect monetary sums/amounts at the rate of 25% of prison funds.

Appeal rights given.  Written Explanation of Determinate Sentence, Pretrial Incarceration Credit and Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief and Ineligible Voting Notice and Acknowledgment received and filed.  Copies given to the defendant.

Defendant Kentrell Deshawn Hughlett in court with attorney Douglas Michael Bihler.  
Marissa Luz Santiago appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: dds.

Matter calendared for Sentencing Hearing on today.  Defense not prepared to proceed as the presentence investigation report has not been reviewed with the defendant.  Defense request for adjournment granted by the court.  Adjourned date selected with the parties.

  Sentencing hearing scheduled for September 22, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Attorney Douglas Michael Bihler in court, defendant Kentrell Deshawn Hughlett not in court, in custody.  Marissa Luz Santiago appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  

Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, and plead GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Stipulation by parties to the Criminal Complaint as a factual basis to sustain the plea.  Court found the defendant guilty.  Judgment of conviction entered.
  
Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess any gun or other firearms. 
Court advised defendant that his voting rights are suspended, and may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored.  

Court also advises defendant if he is not a citizen of the United States of America, that upon a plea of guilty or no contest for this offense, he could be deported, excluded from admission to his country, or denied naturalization under federal law.  
Court advised that the defendant will have to provide a DNA sample, to the Wisconsin State Crime Laboratory for DNA testing.
Ineligible Voting Notice and Acknowledgement, received and filed.  aw

Court advised parties that as of August 3, 2015, this case will be reassigned to Judge Daniel Konkol, Branch 44 in Room 316 of the Safety Bldg.  Case adjourned for sentencing on 9/8/2015 at 8:30 am, branch 44.  Court orders PSI.  PSI order signed and filed.  aw

Court vacates trial date on 8/17/2015.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for September 8, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Kentrell Deshawn Hughlett in court with attorney Douglas Michael Bihler.  Defendant Kentrell Deshawn Hughlett in custody.  Marissa Luz Santiago appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case scheduled for motion hearing, oral ruling, and final pretrial.  Defense counsel has no motion to be filed.  State did not file a motion for joinder.  State has given the defense a new offer.  Case adjourned for final pretrial on 7/2/2015 at 8:30 am, branch 3.  All final pretrial documents due next court date.  aw  Final pre-trial scheduled for July 2, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Kentrell Deshawn Hughlett in court with attorney Douglas Michael Bihler.  Defendant Kentrell Deshawn Hughlett in custody.  Karl P. Hayes appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defense counsel informs the court that the defendant would like him to withdraw.  Court held colloquy with defendant.  Court denies request for attorney Bihler to withdraw.  State to file a motion to join cases 15cf547 and 15cf844 for trial, by 4/13/2015.  Defense to respond by 4/24/2015.  Case adjourned for oral ruling and final pretrial on 6/29/2015 at 1:30 pm, and for jury trial on 8/17/2015 at 8:30 am, branch 3.   Filed, signed Felony Pretrial Scheduling Order.  aw  Oral ruling scheduled for June 29, 2015 at 01:30 pm.  Final pre-trial scheduled for June 29, 2015 at 01:30 pm.  Jury trial scheduled for August 17, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Kentrell Deshawn Hughlett in court with attorney Douglass Bihler.  Defendant Kentrell Deshawn Hughlett in custody.  Karl P. Hayes appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Defendant Kentrell Deshawn Hughlett in court with attorney Benjamin T Van Severen.  Defendant Kentrell Deshawn Hughlett in custody.  Karl P. Hayes appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant has picked up a new counsel, and not able to retain attorney Van Severen.  Defense requests to withdraw.  Court grants motion to withdraw of attorney Van Severn. Defendant Kentrell Deshawn Hughlett in court with attorney Benjamin T Van Severen.  Karl P. Hayes appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Defendant Kentrell Deshawn Hughlett in court with attorney Rosemary Reyes Cuevas.  Michael Thurston appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Fiorenza, Branch 3.
